snippet.title: Jayde Kendall murder accused to face trial in September
snippet.content:
THE man accused of killing schoolgirl Jayde Kendall will face trial in September.
Brenden Jacob Bennetts, 19, is charged with one count of murder and one of interfering with a corpse.
Sixteen-year-old Jayde went missing from Gatton on August 14.
Her body was found on a property in Upper Tenthill, south of Gatton, two weeks later.
Mr Bennetts faced a brief hearing in the Brisbane Supreme Court on Thursday.
His trial is due to start on September 4.
